title: Baked Sweet Potatoes with Spiced Apples and Prunes
ingredients: 2 Granny Smith apples, peeled, halved lengthwise, cored and sliced in wedges
½ cup pitted and minced prunes
½ cup firmly packed light brown sugar
instructions: In a large saucepan cover the sweet potatoes with cold water and bring to a boil.  Simmer the sweet potatoes, covered, for 25 to 30 minutes, or until they are just tender (test with a toothpick).  Drain the sweet potatoes and let them cool until they can be handled.  Peel the sweet potatoes and cut them cross wise into ½-inch slices.
Arrange the sweet potatoes in one layer in a buttered 1½-quart gratin dish.

In a skillet, over moderate heat, add 3 tablespoons of the butter.  When melted add the brown sugar, orange juice, cinnamon, and the cloves.  Bring the mixture to a boil then add in the apples and prunes and cook, stirring, until the apples are softened and well coated with the brown sugar mixture.  Remove from the heat and layer the apple mixture on top of the sweet potatoes then sprinkle the pecans on top.  Cut the final 3 tablespoons of butter in small bits and dot the top of mixture in the gratin dish with them.
Bake the dish in a preheated 375° F. oven for 20 minutes.
source: Adapted from:  Gastronomie Sans Argent, Yams, Gourmet Magazine, November 1984.
